description: Citrix XenServer 7.0 is the free virtualization software from Citrix. It is a commercially backed implementation of the open source Xen virtualization platform. The low cost of entry makes XenServer an attractive option for small and medium businesses looking for advanced hypervisor functions (clustering, live migration, centralized management) without the large price tag associated with competing products. This latest version is designed to integrate better with Windows and provide a feature rich virtualization solution to compete with VMWare and Microsoft's Hyper-V market share.

name: Citrix XenServer 7.0
subtitle: Open-source virtualization

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.284
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:03.284 --> 00:00:07.795
Welcome, if you're looking for information
on your Citrix XenServer version 7.0,

3
00:00:07.795 --> 00:00:09.830
then you are in the right spot.

4
00:00:09.830 --> 00:00:13.490
We have Mr Ronnie Wong in studios to
kind of give a brief description about

5
00:00:13.490 --> 00:00:15.100
what you'll be seeing in this show.

6
00:00:15.100 --> 00:00:16.690
Thank you for joining us today, Ronnie.

7
00:00:16.690 --> 00:00:17.420
>> Well, thank you for

8
00:00:17.420 --> 00:00:22.060
having me back as we take a look now
into the world of Citrix XenServer.

9
00:00:22.060 --> 00:00:25.610
This is a nice open source utility
that really is the commercial offering

10
00:00:25.610 --> 00:00:27.900
by Citrix itself, which is great.

11
00:00:27.900 --> 00:00:31.500
Because it means it's a virtualization
utility that we can all jump into.

12
00:00:31.500 --> 00:00:36.000
Small to medium size businesses can adopt
this and not really have to pay some of

13
00:00:36.000 --> 00:00:40.900
the more pricier features, or pay for more
pricier features that you might find and

14
00:00:40.900 --> 00:00:44.350
other solutions that are really
more pricey in the very end.

15
00:00:44.350 --> 00:00:47.231
What we wanna make sure of
as we enter into this show,

16
00:00:47.231 --> 00:00:51.291
you're gonna end up seeing that we'll
take you from the very beginning of

17
00:00:51.291 --> 00:00:55.483
installing Citrix XenServer onto machines,
showing you how, of course,

18
00:00:55.483 --> 00:00:59.239
to get set up so that you can install
virtual machines on top of that.

19
00:00:59.239 --> 00:01:00.367
Once we get there,

20
00:01:00.367 --> 00:01:04.525
we want to also be able to ensure that
you know how to configure the VMs,

21
00:01:04.525 --> 00:01:10.200
to be able to set up a cluster, we'll walk
you through all of those steps as well.

22
00:01:10.200 --> 00:01:13.720
Moving to the realm of high availability
that way you know how to set that up and

23
00:01:13.720 --> 00:01:15.620
you can test it out too.

24
00:01:15.620 --> 00:01:19.950
And then of course bonding the mix
to give us more bandwidth and

25
00:01:19.950 --> 00:01:22.510
to give us failover there
in our network connections.

26
00:01:22.510 --> 00:01:26.440
In the last few episodes,
we wanna make sure as we go through,

27
00:01:26.440 --> 00:01:30.800
we're going to of course talk about
managing and maintaining the XenServers.

28
00:01:30.800 --> 00:01:33.980
So that we can administrate
what we have available to us.

29
00:01:33.980 --> 00:01:37.110
And then lastly we'll talk
about monitoring and updating.

30
00:01:37.110 --> 00:01:41.310
All of this is just to help you to
get started inside of XenServer.

31
00:01:41.310 --> 00:01:43.840
If you haven't actually thought
about a virtualization tool and

32
00:01:43.840 --> 00:01:47.450
your company is moving towards this,
this is one way that you can consider and

33
00:01:47.450 --> 00:01:51.440
set up a fairly test embed environment,
and that way you can practice it and

34
00:01:51.440 --> 00:01:53.610
see if this might be fitting for you.

35
00:01:53.610 --> 00:01:56.840
So, if you're looking forward to
setting up something like that, well,

36
00:01:56.840 --> 00:01:59.710
this particular episode is
going to be great for you.

37
00:01:59.710 --> 00:02:04.463
So stay tuned for what's coming up next
as you join us in the very first episode.

38
00:02:04.463 --> 00:02:08.499
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this show Ronnie and Cherokee discuss a virtualization option called XenServer. Ronnie explains what virtualization is and what we need to know to get started on this platform. He also covers new features that have been added to this software version.
episodes.title: Intro to Citrix XenServer 7.0

episodes.description: With several virtualization options available Ronnie explains where to go to obtain the installation file and verify file hash values. He and Cherokee then begin the installation process walking you thru step by step.
episodes.title: Install Citrix XenServer 7.0

episodes.description: In this show Ronnie and Cherokee look at what is required to set up a virtual machine. They walk thru the steps to set up a Windows Server 2012r2 virtual machine as well as a CentOS VM.
episodes.title: Create VMs in XenServer

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee configure virtual machine properties. Ronnie will show how to configure vCPU, configure storage and explain networking options to customize your virtual machines for your network.
episodes.title: Configure VM Properties

episodes.description: This show you see Ronnie and Cherokee pick up from the previous episode and finalize the CentOS VM by installing guest tools. Next, Ronnie walks thru the different network storage options.
episodes.title: Configure Storage

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee explain how to set up a cluster or heterogenous resource pool for redundancy. Ronnie shares best practices for configuration as he walks thru the steps.
episodes.title: Create a Cluster

episodes.description: Ronnie and Cherokee continue to configure clusters and complete cluster configurations. In this show they take a look at how to configure high availability clustering. Ronnie walks thru the process step by step.
episodes.title: Create a Cluster Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Cherokee continue to configure clustering. They test for high availability on the completed cluster.
episodes.title: Create a Cluster Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee discuss how to create network interface card teams. By aggregating the functionality of multiple NICs one can increase performance and/or reliability. Ronnie walks thru the process step by step.
episodes.title: Create a NIC Bond

episodes.description: In this show see Ronnie and Cherokee explain the importance of server management and maintenance. Ronnie gives a detailed demonstration of how to create a virtual machine via command line interface over SSH.
episodes.title: Manage and Maintain XenServer

episodes.description: Ronnie and Cherokee explain why it is important to monitor and update your XenServers. Ronnie shows what to monitor such as CPU, RAM, Disk and network utilization. They also discuss why and how to perform updates on your server.
episodes.title: Monitor and Update XenServer
